conclusion: Understand the relationship between pressure and volume of an ideal gas.
Ideal gas law states that pressure and volume are inversely proportional.
Given temperature of gas in state A is 27°C.
Ideal gas law formula: p = nRT/V.
Variables in ideal gas law: p (pressure), n (moles), R (ideal gas constant), T (temperature in Kelvin), V (volume).
Convert temperature from Celsius to Kelvin: 27°C = 299K.
Use ideal gas law to find pressure of gas in state A: p_A = nRT_A/V_A.
Assume pressure is constant at state A value to find volume of state A: V_A = nRT_A/p_A.
Find pressure of gas in state B using same temperature as state A: p_B = nRT_B/V_B.
Assume pressure is constant at state B value to find volume of state B: V_B = nRT_B/p_B.
Find pressure of gas in state C using same temperature as state B: p_C = nRT_C/V_C.
Assume pressure is constant at state C value to find volume of state C: V_C = nRT_C/p_C.
